item.title: Dell Quietly Offloads Its 1TB Laptops via Amazon (74% off), but Displays No Direct Deals on Its Website
item.content:encoded:
Budget laptops typically force compromises on storage, RAM, or processor power to hit accessible price points, and leave buyers frustrated with sluggish performance. Dell quietly sidesteps this problem by offloading fully-loaded Inspiron 15-inch laptops through Amazon rather than advertising aggressive discounts on its own website to protect brand perception while clearing inventory.

The Inspiron 3530 with Intel i7 processor, 32GB RAM, and 1TB SSD currently sells for just $939 on Amazon, slashed from its typical $3,599 price tag. Dell’s own site shows no comparable promotion which makes Amazon the exclusive channel for this 74% discount that brings professional-grade specs down to consumer pricing.

See at Amazon

Dell Loaded This Laptop With Premium Components

Fantastic performance without the thermal throttling that makes cheaper laptops struggle with demanding workflows comes with the 13th generation Intel Core i7-1355U processor. This 10-core chip with 12MB cache revs up as high as 5.0 GHz when needed for responsive computing. Moreover, the integrated graphics in the Intel Iris Xe really push beyond what most mainstream integrated options can provide: This means you’re getting a laptop that will not become obsolete the moment you need to do something more resource-intensive than just basic web browsing and document editing.

Adding 32GB of DDR4 RAM to this machine takes it from merely adequate to truly capable for professional work. Such ample memory allows seamless multitasking among creative applications so you could edit photos in one window, render video in another and monitor your email in a third. For anyone who works with virtual machines, large datasets or memory-intensive development environments, the extra 32GB gives you the headroom that spares you constant application switching and waiting.

This 1TB SSD gives plenty of storage for operating system and personal files without imposing constant cleaning or cloud dependence. Solid-state storage delivers boot times measured in seconds rather than minutes, and applications launch almost instantaneously compared to mechanical hard drives. A PCIe connection provides the drive with the bandwidth needed to operate at maximum speed, meaning large files transfer quickly and the whole system feels responsive.

The anti-glare coating on this 15.6-inch Full HD touchscreen provides excellent visual quality that, during extended work sessions and increases comfort. A 1920×1080 resolution enables one to have sharp rendering of text, which reduces eye strain when working with documents. WVA panel technology assures the viewer of accurate color representation and wide viewing angles.

The options include older legacy USB 2.0 ports for older peripherals, modern USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A and Type-C ports to enable fast data transfer, HDMI 1.4 for external displays, an SD card reader in service of photographers, and a standard headphone jack. WiFi 6 support provides the fastest wireless connectivity currently available, and Bluetooth 5.3 ensures reliable connections to wireless mice, keyboards, and headphones.

Windows 11 Pro includes additional security features and the ability to join a domain that’s not offered in the home versions, while the Copilot AI assistant offers contextual help to make productivity tasks easier.

For $939, this laptop is cheaper than many mid-range machines with half the RAM and storage: it’s a spectacular value that Dell can’t promote too loudly without undermining its premium brand position.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/dell-quietly-offloads-its-1tb-laptops-via-amazon-74-off-but-displays-no-direct-deals-on-its-website-2000642475

item.title: Diablo 4 In China Censored, Blood And Skeletons Removed
item.content:encoded:
After a lot of work and years of waiting, Blizzard’s massively popular loot-filled action RPG Diablo 4 is  officially making its way to China next month. But, due to various regulations in the country regarding the depiction of corpses and supernatural elements, blood and other elements like a big ol’ skeleton boss won’t be featured in the localized version of Diablo 4. 

In July, Diablo 4 was one of the few foreign games officially approved by China’s National Press and Publication Administration for launch in the country. Since then, players have wondered what changes would be made to the game, which features a lot of skeletons, dead bodies, zombies, and gore. Now, via a free early trial available to players who pre-registered to play Diablo 4, we have our first look at some of the changes Blizzard has made to get the game published in China.

As reported by WOWHead on November 10, one of the biggest and most noticeable changes is that in China, Diablo IV doesn’t feature any blood. Instead, blood is replaced with a brown, transparent dust-like effect. In a game where nearly every action against NPCs results in blood splatter or even full-on explosions of sticky red goo, this is a very noticeable difference, especially when fighting large groups of enemies who normally pop like overfilled water balloons when smacked around with a sword.

Another big change spotted by the outlet is that at least one boss has been changed. In the original version of Diablo 4, one of the game’s bosses is Wandering Death, a large, ghostly skeleton who players team up to take down. In China, this Diablo 4 world boss has been turned into a giant made out of rocks and boulders. While WOWHead wasn’t able to confirm how other skeletons look, it’s believed that, due to China’s strict regulations against depictions of dead bodies and occult-like imagery, other skeleton enemies in the ARPG will likely not look the same. Even some icons in Diablo 4 had to be changed to remove skulls.

Of course, these changes will let Diablo 4 launch in China on December 12, over two years after it launched in the rest of the world. I imagine that, for players who have been patiently waiting to play Diablo 4 in China, these changes won’t ruin the fun of killing four million enemies and picking up 400 swords.



https://kotaku.com/diablo-4-china-censored-blood-skeletons-skulls-censorship-changes-removed-2000642581

item.title: This Game Tests If People Know How Much Porn Characters Have On The Internet, And They’re Failing
item.content:encoded:
You know what they say: “Rule 34: If it exists, there is porn of it.” This internet rule posits that every fictional character has lewd art of them somewhere online, and there’s a website called Rule 34 that curates it and lets you search by character. But are you internet poisoned enough to be able to guess which characters have the most entries on that site? I thought I was, but I was very wrong.

Rule34dle is a browser game that pits two characters or franchises against one another and asks you to guess which of the pair has been the subject of more smutty art on the internet. I figured this would be easy. I know who the sickos are on the internet, and I also know which fandoms have the most artistically inclined community members. Or so I thought. But even after being a fan for nearly 30 years and writing about the series almost every day here at Kotaku, I underestimated the depravity of the Pokémon fandom. What do you mean Snivy, the sassy little snake guy from Black and White, has more entries than Kitana from Mortal Kombat?

In just a few minutes of guessing, I was repeatedly taken aback by the gaps between some characters. Sometimes they were as wide as the ocean, and at other times they were too close for comfort. Leavanny from Pokémon being just a couple of hundred entries away from the frost giant heartthrob Loki? That didn’t sound right, so I went investigating, and lo and behold, it was true. Do with that information what you will.

The surprising answers do make Rule34dle a really fun game to play with friends or on stream. I’ve started seeing streamers play the game, and they’re also shocked at some of the results, so maybe some of us have just never quite peered into the abyss long enough.

If you want to try it out, none of the NSFW stuff is shown in the game itself, so you’re safe on that front. You can also try AO3dle, which is the same concept but specifically pulling from fanfiction site Archive of Our Own. That one at least offers some plausible deniability because not everything on there is porn.



https://kotaku.com/rule-34-rule34dle-guessing-game-stream-site-where-play-2000642575

item.title: World Record Holder Subjects His Body To 144 Straight Hours Of DDR
item.content:encoded:
I’ve had some remarkably long gaming sessions in my time. At least, I thought they were remarkably long. Turns out, I’m an amateur when compared to the likes of Szabolcs Csépe, also known as GrassHopper, a Hungarian gamer who now lays claim to the Guinness World Records’ title of “longest videogame marathon” for playing Dance Dance Revolution for 144 hours, or six straight days.

Dancing to more than 3,000 songs, and apparently burning 22,000 calories in the process, GrassHopper soared past the previous world record of 138 hours, which was set by Carrie Swidecki in 2015 while playing Just Dance (h/t VGC). In fact, the previous record was an inspiration for GrassHopper who said, “Ever since I learned about [Swidecki’s] achievements in marathon gaming, I often caught myself thinking about how she pulled the all-time longest session off almost a decade ago.

Though Grasshopper certainly sweated the most and burned the most calories during the six-day marathon, it was a team effort. As Grasshopper said,

This attempt was the most physically demanding experience, where the arms and shoulders expressed fatigue for extended hours without stretching. Apart from physically training for marathon gaming sessions, I prepared with the two most important keys to succeed: doing serious practice attempts with a small staff, and also coming up with a plan for supporting your body with sufficient food and water intake.

This isn’t GrassHopper’s first rodeo when it comes to marathoning games and setting records. He previously broke the world record for the longest time spent playing a racing game, the game being Gran Turismo 7, and the time being 90 friggin’ hours. He also holds the world record for the longest video game marathon spent playing a puzzle game, with 32 straight hours of Tetris.

Well, the next time I’m miserably powering through a metcon, I’ll be sure to remind myself it could be worse; I could be playing DDR for 144 hours. Bravo, sir. Bravo.



https://kotaku.com/ddr-worlds-longest-gaming-marathon-record-grasshoper-2000642566

item.title: T-Rex No Longer A Shitty Dad After New Jurassic World Evolution 3 Update
item.content:encoded:
Being a dad is hard. You have to take care of your child. Protect it from dangers. Make sure it gets plenty of food, water, and sleep. Oh and yeah, not eat it. Unfortunately for juvenile Tyrannosaurs in Jurassic World Evolution 3, dad was forgetting that last rule. But that’s been fixed in the game’s latest update, available now on all platforms.

Released last month, Jurassic World Evolution 3 is a fantastic dinosaur-park-building simulation that lets you live out the fantasy of opening your very own Jurassic Park and hopefully not screwing it all up in the process, as seen in nearly every film. This latest entry in the series, which is also the best one yet, added a highly requested fan feature: juvenile dinos. But apparently, according to new patch notes from developer Frontier, male T. Rexes were being jerks and attacking their offspring.

On November 10, in the lengthy patch notes for JWE3 update 1.1.0, there’s this odd bug fix:

 – Adult male Tyrannosaurus Rex no longer attack their juvenile offspring

Yeah, it looks like T. Rex was being a shitty dad before the update and had a tendency to attack juvenile T-rexes. This doesn’t shock me, as in my experience with the large carnivorous dinos, they are quick to attack basically anything that enters their enclosure. At least now, baby Rexes won’t be attacked by their own fathers anymore.

Here are the full patch notes for 1.1.0: 

Updates

  • Introduced a new family unit to the game – the Kentrosaurus
  • Adjusted navigation rules so that dinosaurs can travel beneath and around scenery items more freely
  • Added further keyboard shortcuts to in-game control hints when placing or moving scenery
  • Improvements to LODs on PC:
    • Added ‘Very High’ setting to Foliage detail
    • Updated the ‘Very High’ quality preset to correctly use the ‘Very High’ settings for foliage and geo detail
    • Improved level of detail for feathered dinosaurs on lower spec hardware
  • Revised sandbox settings for preventing juveniles from being hunted in sandbox maps:
    • The ‘Aggressive Animals’ setting is now changed to ‘Vulnerable Juveniles’ (this new setting will inherit the setup from the previous ‘Aggressive Animal’ setting from current saves)
    • It now disables all juvenile attacks instead of just disabling attacks against juveniles of the same species
    • Setting the fight frequency sandbox setting to ‘None’ now prevents juveniles from being attacked
    • Setting the cohabitation sandbox setting to ‘All Like’ now prevents juveniles from being attacked
  • Path and Fence building modes now default ‘Replace Mode’ to ‘Off’ when opened
  • Pylons can now be placed between Islands on maps made with Island Generator
  • Added guest food scattering animation for Dinosaur Encounter attraction
  • Adjusted frequency of Dinosaurs present in Dinosaur Encounter attraction
  • Added group edit shortcut when playing with mouse. Double-click a group to enter group edit mode.
  • Added new help screens for Alternative Camera Controls and Foundation Floor Pieces
  • Added screen effect when time controls are open to clarify focus (gamepad only)
  • Created new biome filter label for foliage scenery items

Complexity Meter

  • Memory optimisation to improve complexity meter limits on Sandbox and Challenge parks
  • Save game optimisations to increase complexity meter limits on Campaign levels
  • Performance optimisations to improve complexity meter limits on dinosaur intensive parks

Console Only

  • Added an Override Performance Limits option to the Gameplay Settings menu
    • This opt-in setting frees up space in the Complexity Meter, where performance limits can be overridden by allowing frame rates to drop. The impact of this override will vary from park to park
    • If building continues with the Override turned ‘On’, the setting may become inactive until the park’s overall complexity is reduced again

Bug Fixes

Campaign

  • Resolved issue causing the Maiasaura to be automatically selected in the hatchery UI during Badlands campaign level
  • Resolved Lokiceratops comfort objective completing automatically in Badlands campaign level
  • Resolved several issues around the limited UI during tutorial sections of the Badlands campaign level
  • Adjusted Diplodocus behavior in the Badlands campaign level to ensure they consistently escape during the relevant story event
  • Improved territory generation for Psittacosaurus in Hawaii campaign level
  • Fixed issue preventing the player from selecting Brachiosaurus’ in Biosyn Sanctuary campaign level
  • Fixed issue where juvenile Parasaurolophus do not follow their parents in the final campaign mission
  • Resolved rare issue in Japan Campaign level causing park section to not unlock when conditions fulfilled

Sandbox

  • Added ‘Operations Building Limits’ Sandbox setting to allow players to have multiple of the same operation buildings that are usually limited

Dinosaurs

  • Improved Iguanodon’s default cosmetic set
  • Adjusted alignment of Styracosaurus during its attack fence animation
  • Adult male Tyrannosaurus Rex no longer attack their juvenile offspring
  • Resolved issue where Tyrannosaurus Rex were not hunting goats
  • Deinonychus, Metriacanthosaurus and Suchomimus will now attack guests
  • Fixed multiple issues causing some dinosaurs to constantly activate a dust particle effect
  • Resolved juvenile Triceratops losing their territory when entering a Dinosaur Encounter attraction
  • Improvements to Deinonychus’ animations to resolve neck and arm distortion
  • Resolved issue where adult Spinosaurus teleport a short distance after being transported
  • Resolved issue where tails of Dimetrodon would shake unnaturally during drinking animation
  • Improved alignment during fights, social interactions and other behaviors for multiple dinosaurs
  • Fixed issue with teeth placement for juvenile Mamenchisaurus
  • Updated Allosaurus JWE skins
  • Suchomimus and Baryonyx can now cohabitate
  • Lystrosaurus and Therizinosaurus can now cohabitate
  • Resolved issue where Pachycephalosaurus juveniles have no eyes
  • Adjusted number of Dreadnoughtus that can hatch at one time
  • Updated Psittacosaurus family category to Ceratopsid

Localisation

  • Various localisation fixes, including subtitle edits and translation of newly added lines

Management

  • Fixed crash when attempting to pilot an Aviary or Lagoon drone
  • Resolved issue where reloading a save that has a helicopter delivering a dinosaur would cause the helicopter to fall
  • Resolved issue causing Extra Scientist Hatchery upgrade to not work

Park Construction

  • Adjusted depth of rocks being generated in deep water to avoid dinosaurs and Cretaceous Cruises being blocked
  • Resolved UI issues when creating a building blueprint without necessary modules
  • Improved how scenery affects dinosaur territory and navigation
  • Improved collision on foliage spawned by Conifer Woodland environment brush
  • Further improvements to collision on large scenery rocks and auto-generated rocks within environment brushes
  • Resolved issue where building blueprints could be placed underground in Biosyn Sanctuary map if placed quickly after selecting it
  • Resolved issue where path curb colour would change at random
  • Messaging now shows why a damaged building cannot be deleted
  • Now possible to duplicate one scenery piece when selected with the multi select tool
  • Adjusted refund price of Power Stations
  • Resolved issue preventing deletion of individual scenery item trees
  • Resolved lack of sound effect for feeders opening and closing

Stability

  • General performance and stability improvements
  • Improved performance when opening and closing the environment panel
  • Fixed crash caused by moving several bench scenery pieces together
  • Improved performance when using demolish brush to demolish an aviary with a tour route running through it
  • Fixed crash caused by undoing and redoing building modules
  • Resolved crash in sandbox when selecting unresearched pylons within the build menu
  • Fixed rare crash when selecting to release via airlift from a hatchery
  • Resolved occasional crash when a juvenile starts a chase
  • Fixed a crash caused by deleting a lagoon or aviary hatchery while a transport request was in operation
  • Resolved shadow quality setting reverting to medium when set to low
  • Resolved terrain textures disappearing at certain aspect ratios

UI

  • Adjusted cursor alignment in expedition map
  • Adjusted scenery UI scaling to ensure Lagoon Decorations category is accessible on all platforms
  • Resolved issue causing filter button to not appear in Scenery menu
  • Improved responsiveness of Control Room UI
  • Adjusted text for Spinoceratops research node
  • Adjusted text for Dinosaur Encounter attraction’s help screen
  • Cleaned up thumbnails for Community Creations when exiting the build menu
  • More closely aligned a number of pattern and color swatches to a dinosaurs hatchery 3D preview
  • Adjusted controller prompt text for accuracy
  • Updated frontier support website link shown on Save/Load error
  • Resolved inability to back out of EULA and Licenses page with the ESC key

Workshop

  • Fixed crash when uninstalling a large number of community creations from ‘Installs’ and then changing page
  • Resolved UI overlapping when opening a creator profile and a player report at the same time
  • Resolved thumbnails not loading in workshop
  • Added Community Creations panel for Park Tour menus

Camera Modes

  • Resolved audio issue when using camera zoom in Capture Mode
  • Added ability to zoom camera while riding the Balloon Tour
  • Resolved time of day changing unexpectedly when entering Capture Mode


https://kotaku.com/jurassic-world-evolution-3-1-1-0-patch-notes-t-rex-fix-juveniles-2000642549
